profiles:
Summary I started my career as an analyst developer at U.S. Steel. Although several programs I came across were written before I was born, I quickly found a way to integrate the mainframe data into a Cognos reporting engine and drive value out of the data. I learned about cross-platform integration and large corporate financials along the way. 
 
In my next position at Mellon Financial, I wrote applications to automate manual tasks for a custom-developed financial application.  
 
At Accenture, I joined the consulting workforce first spending 3 years integrating SmartMeter systems for a major utility before moving to cloud computing related work. My work with cloud technologies at Accenture was primarily with Google technologies which allowed me to develop expertise in Google Apps and Google Enterprise products. 
 
In my current role, I am an Enterprise Sales Engineer for Google Apps. I spend my time with Google Apps partners and customers helping them evaluate the product, map technical/business requirements and design solutions. Summary 
I am enthusiastic Gen Yer on an a unique journey as a Google Sales Engineer working along side large enterprise Clients.  
 
Beginning in a selective Google advertising program, followed by an sales internship which lead to my role as a Sales Engineer in the Google For Work Team.  
 
I pride my self on being a hard and fast learner, a curve ball thinker and tech tinker. 
 
Most importantly, I like to be challenged.

Happy viewing. Experience Google For Work Sales Engineer Google September 2014  – Present (1 year) Sydney Area, Australia Analyse Business Challenges of the Customer, and clarify how our Solutions can solve them 
 
Proactively lead Technical activities throughout the Sales Cycle, including Demos, Immersive Experiences, Customer interactions, Security.  
 
Work closely with our Sales Team, to provide guidance on technical aspects of our solutions 
 
Sustain our Partners with constant enablement to make them efficient in presales activities and knowledgeable on Google’s solutions 
 
Promote and explain Google culture of Innovation  
 Internship - Google For Work Sales Engineer Google March 2014  –  September 2014  (7 months) Sydney Area, Australia Marketing and Student Recruitment - Faculty of Social Sciences University of Wollongong August 2013  –  March 2014  (8 months) University of Wollongong Supported the domestic and international marketing activities in the Faculty of Social Sciences. Wollongong university is ranked in the top 2% of university world wide.  
 
Assistant Roles include:  
* Analysing large student excel data bases and working closely to recruitment targets (e.g enrollment)  
* Assisting in a large website re code project using CMS editing systems 
* Stake Holder Liaison and engagement (UnivAdvice and Strategic Marketing & Communications) 
* Designing marketing collateral (Discipline Booklets, Faculty intranet, brochures, flyers, posters) 
* Media buying and planning including core online/print, University publications and SEO.  
* Working closely with the UOW Media Office and local media on positive exposure for the Faculty 
* Conducting competitor analysis and market research 
* Measuring return-on-investment (ROI) through media and recruitment monitoring on online/offline  
* Strategy develop for Social media 
* Participating in recruitment and marketing events involving public speaking and presentation at Discovery Days, Partnership Conferences, Career Markets, Orientation,school link visits. Google Student Ambassador Google February 2013  –  February 2014  (1 year 1 month) Sydney Area, Australia The Google Student Ambassador Program (GSA) is a selective opportunity for students to act as a liaison between Google and their universities. As an Ambassador I am thrilled about new technology and enthusiastic about sharing Google products and culture on campus!  
 
Ambassador Roles include:  
* Learning about innovative Google products and programs 
* Planing and hosting fun events on campus with various student bodies and clubs 
* Maintaining and updating the GSA Google+ and Facebook accounts 
* Assisting UOW Information Technology Services (ITS) with implementing Google learning tools 
 
ACHIEVEMENTS: Presented Google Docs and Drive to a lecture theatre of over 300 staff and students at UOW. Commerce Student Representative University of Wollongong January 2012  –  December 2013  (2 years) Wollongong Area, Australia -	Assisted in the organisation and preparation of Commerce Academic Preparation Days (2013) 
-	Presented a formal speech at the Year 12 Taster Day (2013) in front of over 300 students 
- International computer Lab enrollment assistant, O-Week (2012/2013) 
-	Contributed to the development of the University’s International advertising campaign  
 
Achievements: Selected to present a 15 minute formal speech at Orientation Day Autumn and spring 2013 in front of up to 300 hundred prospective business students, teachers and staff about my experiences as a university student. Senior Retail Assistant Billabong July 2009  –  November 2013  (4 years 5 months) Wollongong Area, Australia -	Reached and exceeding large KPI’S and sales targets 
-	Handled large large product data bases  
-	Recruited and trained new staff  
-	Tackled daily business challenges including customer complaints, returns and exchanges 
-	Developed staff training solutions and store management processes 
-	Attended nationally recognised sales and customer training programs  
 
Achievements: Named Billabongs Lead Sales Persons 2012 for providing excellent customer service having accomplished large KPI’s, package selling and budgets. Student Tutor and Mentor - IN2UNI Program University of Wollongong March 2013  –  October 2013  (8 months) Wollongong Area, Australia In2Uni is a mentor support and outreach program developed by the Department of Education (DEC NSW) and the University of Wollongong (UOW) to enable students in low socio economic schools to participate and succeed in higher education. The university provides student mentors from Batmen's Bay to southern Sydney with the goal of increasing low SES university intake.  
 
Mentor Roles included:  
* Facilitating weekly 1 Hour lessons with up to 30 high school students from years 7-12  
* Implementing large-scale on campus events for high school students 
* Maintained partnerships and relationships with schools, community groups, parents, and sponsors 
* Assisted in administrative matters involved in the program including student databases  
* Delivered student experience speeches to participating IN2UNI schools 
 
ACHIEVEMENTS: Marketing and Communications Intern - Careers Central University of Wollongong February 2013  –  June 2013  (5 months) Wollongong Area, Australia -	Supported the Marketing and Programs Coordinator for 3 months 
-	Comfortably worked on creating, merging and updating large employee databases  
-	Assisted with challenging projects including three large careers fairs with over 60 employers 
-	Implemented social media strategy’s including developing a media schedule  
-	Developed a range of media (web copy writing, media release, print, and advertising)  
-	Handled student career enquires including appointments and providing customer service  
 
Achievements: Implemented ‘Google Analytics’ which is now used to research online trends and to tailor various media platforms, including those pages which received the most student traffic. Google AdCamp Google January 2013  –  January 2013  (1 month) Sydney Area, Australia Selected as one of 22 students nationally to participate in a four day introduction to Google's Advertising and Sales techniques. Among sessions taught by inspiring Googlers, I worked on a team challenge to develop a digital strategy for Target which was pitched to established Google leaders.  
 
Session topics included: 
* Googles 7 Point Sales Frame Work 
* Google Display Network (GDN), Audience Targeting & YouTube Advertising 
* Google Search, Clicks and AdWords, online restate 
* Analytics, measuring ROI and Ad Ranks 
* Advanced training in public speaking and sales pitching  
 
ACHIEVEMENTS: Received two Highly Commended awards winning 2/3 individual challenges which included a Google Plus Tech task and a Google Review blogging challenge. Public Relations Internship - Pulse & Howorth Ogilvy Public Relations Worldwide January 2012  –  March 2012  (3 months) Sydney Area, Australia Completed an internship with Ogilvy Public Relations working in the Public Relations sector across two divisions, Pulse (Consumer) and Howorth (B2B). I worked closely clients such as Microsoft, LG, Canon, Intel, Tremble. 
 
-	Monitored coverage using Google,Facebook and Twitter for LG’s Technology Conference  
-	Reported results by populating extensive spreadsheet with media trends and circulation  
-	Created the international Ogilvy events calendar combing large sets of data and events  
-	Researched online trends using ‘Google trends’ to generate topics for client bloggers 
-	Worked on creating an online advertising solution for Telstra's movie downloading function. 
- Assisting in events (Malaysian Kitchen food festival)  
 
Achievements: Supported the Haworth B2B Team on implementing all stages of an online digital media strategy for Tremble, a large GPS company. Key milestones included coverage reports, developing a new business proposal, conducting media analysis and developing the final pitch. Lead Marketing and Communication Volunteer The Cancer Council NSW April 2011  –  September 2011  (6 months) Wollongong Area, Australia For 6 months I volunteered with the Community Relations Manager at the Illawarra Cancer Council and supported the Marketing and Communications Department. 
 
Assistant Role: 
*Provided public relations, marketing and communications support for Relay for Life, The Biggest Morning Tea and Daffodil Day 
* Analysed and populated large volunteer data bases  
* Media relations and stakeholder engagement (i98FM, Win News and The Mercury) 
* Updated and created content for social media 
* Producing and published web copy write and press releases 
 
ACHIEVEMENTS: Implemented a creative strategy to create awareness towards Daffodil Day. Cemented a deal with Lightsounds Wollongong to donate three days of lighting to turn the Breakwater Lighthouse, in Wollongong, yellow. Organised a media launch and invited the local community to view the first illumination. Summary David is a solutions architect for the Google Maps team and advises Google's top global partners and large customers on the adoption of new technologies for mobile, web and the cloud.  
 
David works with Google's global top partners to craft scalable solutions for a wide range of complex geospatial applications such as -- location intelligence, indoor mapping & navigation, telematics, mobile apps, big data analytics and imagery.  
 
Before joining Google, David spent 10 years in the aerospace industry as a program manager developing advanced imaging satellites, remote sensing systems, sensors and data fusion systems. 
 
David has spoken on the topics of cloud computing, the use of mapping data for crisis response, and the use of imagery to collect analytics and activity-based intelligence. David has also previously been involved in a variety of web startup activities, such as founding LiveLocker.com which was featured on TechCrunch in in 2006.
